title: [Feature Request] Allow Dataloader workers to sleep instead of busy wait
body_html:
Is there any way we can get the workers in Dataloader to sleep when not doing anything? The busy waiting it currently does in the process's "loop" takes up a lot of resources, and I am getting complaints about them as we are using a shared machine. Maybe you'd have one sentinel process that would wake up the others every time the Dataloader iterator gets asked for a new batch.

I'm on Linux 3.10.0-693.11.6.el7.x86_64 (output from uname -r), with torch.__version__ stating '0.3.0.post4' installed via conda. I am running Python 3.6.1 (Anaconda version). Not sure what my CUDA or cuDNN versions are. I have 4 Titan X Pascals.

Thanks!
